column3: <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! It's a pleasure to cross paths with you again.
My journey continues, thanks to you and Kupopo. After my return to reality, I took to the road in search of fresh perspectives, and I've found plenty of them here in Radz-at-Han.
This city fascinates me to no end... Life flourishes in every color, and my imagination has grown all the richer for it!

I plan to roam Thavnair for a time and aid those in need along the way. If I can make a positive difference in this world with my pictomancy─just as you and our predecessors have─then it will all be worth it.
As you well know, we pictomancers are wielders of the imagination, rendering our wildest dreams into reality with a magicked brush.
The origins of pictomancy can be traced back to the Fifth Astral Era, when a young woman named Relm began weaving aether into her works of art.
Relm was a selfless soul and refused to stand idly by as the War of the Magi raged on. She saved a great many lives on her travels, and earned the title of Archon for her deeds.
As her disciples, it is our duty to wander this star and shine the light of hope for those in need.
